metadata.title: CVE-2024-26929 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:qla2xxx: Fix double free of fcport The server was crashing after LOGObecause fcport was getting freed twice. -----------[ cut here ]-----------kernel BUG at mm/slub.c:371! invalid opcode: 0000 1 SMP PTI CPU: 35 PID:4610 Comm: bash Kdump: loaded Tainted: G OE --------- - -4.18.0-425.3.1.el8.x86_64 #1 Hardware name: HPE ProLiant DL360Gen10/ProLiant DL360 Gen10, BIOS U32 09/03/2021 RIP:0010:set_freepointer.part.57+0x0/0x10 RSP: 0018:ffffb07107027d90 EFLAGS:00010246 RAX: ffff9cb7e3150000 RBX: ffff9cb7e332b9c0 RCX: ffff9cb7e3150400RDX: 0000000000001f37 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: ffff9cb7c0005500 RBP:fffff693448c5400 R08: 0000000080000000 R09: 0000000000000009 R10:0000000000000000 R11: 0000000000132af0 R12: ffff9cb7c0005500 R13:ffff9cb7e3150000 R14: ffffffffc06990e0 R15: ffff9cb7ea85ea58 FS:00007ff6b79c2740(0000) GS:ffff9cb8f7ec0000(0000) knlGS:0000000000000000 CS:0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033 CR2: 000055b426b7d700 CR3:0000000169c18002 CR4: 00000000007706e0 DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1:0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000 DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6:00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400 PKRU: 55555554 Call Trace:kfree+0x238/0x250 qla2x00_els_dcmd_sp_free+0x20/0x230 [qla2xxx] ?qla24xx_els_dcmd_iocb+0x607/0x690 [qla2xxx] qla2x00_issue_logo+0x28c/0x2a0[qla2xxx] ? qla2x00_issue_logo+0x28c/0x2a0 [qla2xxx] ?kernfs_fop_write+0x11e/0x1a0 Remove one of the free calls and add check forvalid fcport. Also use function qla2x00_free_fcport() instead of kfree().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-233-generic - 4.15.0-233.245
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-233-generic - 4.15.0-233.245
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-233-lowlatency - 4.15.0-233.245
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-193-generic - 5.4.0-193.213~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-193-lowlatency - 5.4.0-193.213~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-233.245').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-193.213~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1160.165').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.190').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1131.141~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1185.200').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1136.143~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1131.142').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').

linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').

linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1130.139~18.04.1').

linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2115.121').
